data.title: "Tests" in Russia?
data.meta_description: Access 135+ million publications and connect with 20+ million researchers. Join for free and gain visibility by uploading your research.
data.text:
In the February 1957 issue of the Bulletin of the (French) National Institute for the Study of Work and for Vocational Guidance appeared a short paper by a member of the Moscow Academy of Pedagogy which contains a few sentences which suggest that psychological tests may possibly again be used in Russia. It will be interesting to watch further developments. (PsycINFO Database Record (c) 2012 APA, all rights reserved)

I work in the department of preschool pedagogy, Moscow State Correspondence Pedagogical Institute. We are involved in training specialists for the public preschool education system. We have various forms of instructionâ€”daytime, evening, and correspondence. Graduates are given a diploma of methodologist in preschool education and instructor in preschool pedagogy. This broad-range diploma gives graduates the right to work in a pedagogical training school, organs of public education, preschool institutions, and scientific research institutes.

View
